title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 966/85 of 11 April 1985 re-establishing the levying of customs duties on watch cases and parts of watch cases, falling within heading No 91.09 and originating in Hong Kong, to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 3562/84 apply
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 966/85
of 11 April 1985
re-establishing the levying of customs duties on watch cases and parts of watch cases, falling within heading No 91.09 and originating in Hong Kong, to which the preferential tariff arrangements set out in Council Regulation (EEC) No 3562/84 apply
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
As from 16 April 1985, the levying of customs duties, suspended pursuant to Council Regulation (EEC) No 3562/84, shall be re-established on imports into the Community of the following products originating in Hong Kong:
1.2 //   //   // CCT heading No  // Description  //   //  // 91.09 (NIMEXE-code 91.09 all numbers)  // Watch cases and parts of watch cases  //   //

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 11 April 1985.
For the Commission
COCKFIELD
Vice-President
(1) OJ No L 338, 27. 12. 1984, p. 1.
